intro: Dictamnus major, commonly known as the greater dictamnus, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Rutaceae family, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its aromatic, glandular leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, fragrant white or pinkish flowers in early summer. Its bark and leaves contain essential oils that have been used in traditional medicine. The plant is also noted for its ability to thrive in rocky or dry soils, making it a hardy species in various environments.
